Council of Catholic Women
Council of Catholic Women
Jeremy Katherman
2024-08-20T04:19:36-04:00
CCW Welcome!
St. Raphael’s CCW is a member of Our Lady Star of the Sea District (formally known as the Lower Pinellas Deanery), which is a geographical designation. There are six districts that make up the Diocesan Council.. Presently Our Lady Star of the Sea District includes St. Raphael, Holy Family, and St. Paul parishes. Our CCW is proud to have had two members who were Diocesan presidents and six who were District presidents.
St. Raphael’s CCW Serves Our Church, School and Community
Our Council annually gives financial assistance for School Scholarships and Parish Youth Group activities. Members donate gifts for residents of Shore Acres Nursing Home. Charitable contributions have been given to the Water for Life, Catholic Relief Services, Alpha House, Casa, St. Vincent de Paul, St. Petersburg Free Clinic, Tampa Children’s Home,  Bridging Freedom, Hugs for the Homeless, Foundations for Life, and many others. Members serve as volunteers throughout the community. In their role as Extraordinary Ministers of Holy Communion, our ladies visit the homebound, patients in hospitals and nursing homes.
Meetings and Events
General Meetings are the 1st Saturday of the Month after the 8:00am Mass.  Rosary begins at 7:30am.
School Festival
(Dessert Booth)
Christmas Brunch
(Parish Center)
Jewelry & Handbag Sale
(Parish Center)
CCW Mini Retreat
Divine Mercy Holy Hour
(St. Raphael Church)
May Crowning
(St. Raphael Church)

Finance Council
Finance Council
Chuck Donnels
2025-03-18T09:29:23-04:00
Mission Statement
Guided by our faith and commitment to responsible stewardship, the Parish Finance Council serves as a trusted advisor to our pastor and parish community in managing financial resources with integrity, transparency, and accountability. We strive to ensure the financial stability of our parish and parish school, supporting its mission of worship, education, and service. Through careful planning, prudent decision-making, and open communication, we seek to honor the gifts of our parishioners and sustain the spiritual and operational needs of our church for generations to come.
Finance Council Members:
Vicki Tylman
Council Chairperson
James Fama
Darryl Leclair
Jordan Loh
Tom Petrillo
Frank Robinson

News & Events
News & Events
Jeremy Katherman
2024-12-19T09:32:26-05:00
Welcome Weekend Retreat
SAVE THE DATE – January 11-12, 2025!  ST RAPHAEL’S WOMEN’S WELCOME WEEKEND RETREAT
WELCOME is an incredible experience that will recharge your faith life, help you develop lasting friendships, and fill you with newfound energy and purpose. For more information – call or text Jocelyn Pedalino at 727-744-1022 or Deb Fusek at 727-685-6308.
SIGN-UPS ARE NOW OPEN – SPACE IS LIMITED!
Learn More Here
“I have to admit at first I was reluctant to join the Women Welcome Weekend, BUT it is by far the best decision I have made.  As I sat listening to all the speakers, I knew I had made the right decision.  The women courageously told their stories and  I finally realized what was missing in my life this Christian Community.  A community that does not judge, a community of caring people, which speak your language about religion.  I cannot begin to tell you how my life has been changing.”
Josephine Spinelli
“Welcome felt like an opening in my life. I was deeply impacted by the stories the women presented on how God has moved in their lives. I began to make new friendships in just a few days. We are not a group of perfect women, but we all fit. We are growing together in friendships that have gone beyond the conference weekend into my life. I have become more active spiritually and I feel God’s presence more deeply.”
Karolina Zimniak
“When I walked into the Welcome Weekend, I wasn’t even Catholic. I was excited about growing in my knowledge of the Catholic faith after a lifetime of being Protestant. Yet, I still felt like an outsider. The Welcome Weekend helped me begin to experience St. Raphael’s in a whole new way because it connected me with the women of the parish for the first time. It also helped me to connect more deeply with God. I now have a circle of friends that I can laugh and cry with. We encourage one another and pray for each other, which has been a special blessing for us all.”
Deb Fusek
Exodus 90: January 20th – Easter
Kick Off:
The kick-off date will be announced in the near future.
90 Day challenge begins January 20th
If you have questions about Exodus 90 Contact the Parish Office.
